page.title: 05SPORT - SAILING
page.content:
The area is noted for its sailing and golfing facilities. Sailing is centred around the{Hoylake Sailing {Club,}which along with West Kirby S.C. uses the locally built{"Hilbre"}class boats as well as the more familiar types of craft. Other yachtsmen moor boats here during the summer. In recent years water skiing has become popular.
Sadly, sand banks are encroaching and it may soon be impossible to sail from this part of the coast. Already there are problems with Spartina growth on the foreshore, and there are fears that an area of marshland will develop, as found in the nearby Dee estuary. Each year volunteers dig out the new growth but may well be fighting a losing battle.
